<div class="asset-content subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<p>Attention all users of the Wellsboro Water System. In compliance with the Department of Environmental Protection requirements, the Borough of Wellsboro is instituting a precautionary boil water advisory. We have been experiencing a reduced filtering capacity on both Slow Sand Filters which has necessitated a precautionary Boil Water Advisory. The Borough is aggressively pursuing the correction of this problem. We are anticipating this will be a short term problem.</p>
<div data-tnt-ads-tmp='{"vendor":"blox","type":"region","region":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset","id":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset","pos":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset, atf","fold":"above","include_domain":null,"size":"[300,250]","height":"250","width":"300","mobile":false,"js":{"video":"https:\/\/bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com\/tiogapublishing.com\/shared-content\/art\/tncms\/templates\/libraries\/flex\/components\/video\/resources\/scripts\/video.512a6903eae08e033c76afdce2a0eac7.js"},"overline":null,"index_slug":null,"url":"\/news\/breaking_news"}' style="display:none;"></div>
<div data-refreshable="true" data-region="fixed-big-ad-top-asset"><div class="tncms-region-ads" id="tncms-region-ads-fixed-big-ad-top-asset">
<div id="blox-ad-position-fixed-big-ad-top-asset1">
<script type="text/javascript">TNCMS.AdManager.render({region: 'fixed-big-ad-top-asset', slot: 1, fold: "above"});</script>

</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><p><strong>DO NOT DRINK THE WATER WITHOUT BOILING IT FIRST.</strong> Bring all water to a boil, let it boil for one minute, and let it cool before using, or use bottled water. Boiled or bottled water should be used for drinking, making ice, brushing teeth, washing dishes, and food preparation <span style="text-decoration: underline;">UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE.</span> Boiling kills bacteria and other organisms that may be found in the water.</p>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

        __tnt.trackEvent = function(obj) {
            if( jQuery.type(obj) === 'object' ){

                        TNCMS.Tracking.addEvent({
                            app: obj.app,
                            metric: obj.metric,
                            id: obj.uuid
                        });
                    }
                
            }
        }
        
        if(__tnt.trackEventLater.length > 0){
            jQuery(__tnt.trackEventLater).each(function(){
                __tnt.trackEvent($(this));
            });
        }

	_cc7100.bcp();
});

	}

Illinois American Water’s Peoria District lifts boil water advisory this afternoon

Thursday
May 31, 2012 at 12:01 AM May 31, 2012 at 6:12 PM

Illinois American Water has lifted the boil water advisory in effect for a portion of the Peoria District late this afternoon.



The affected area includes Mossville at Sherman Road as well as all Illinois American Water customers in that area to the North. Affected neighborhoods include Mossville, Rome, Woodland Heights, Pinewood Estates, Edgewater and Galena Knolls.


Illinois American Water has lifted the boil water advisory in effect for a portion of the Peoria District late this afternoon.

The affected area includes Mossville at Sherman Road as well as all Illinois American Water customers in that area to the North. Affected neighborhoods include Mossville, Rome, Woodland Heights, Pinewood Estates, Edgewater and Galena Knolls.

Water quality tests have confirmed the water continues to meet all U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Safe Drinking Water Act standards and regulations. It is no longer necessary for residents to boil their water before drinking or cooking.

During this precautionary boil water advisory, Illinois American Water performed a series of tests to determine if the water meets regulatory drinking water standards. 

Samples were taken from sites in the affected area and tests confirmed that the water meets all federal requirements.

Boil Water Notice in Effect for Tahoka

Allen Corbin
May 31, 2012
  • Share on Twitter
  • Share on Facebook

A boil water notice is in effect for a South Plains town going into this weekend.

A six inch water main has cracked in the town of Tahoka in the 1200 block of North Sixth Street. The break in the water main occurred around 6:30 p.m. on Thursday evening.

Residents are urged to boil their water for consumption until full water services are restored to Tahoka. Restoration of the broken main is underway, but no timetable has been given.

Filed Under: boil water notice, tahoka tx

<a class="h6 gray-dark-link text-capitalize block-display air-xxs" href="https://patch.com/michigan/rochester/around-town">community corner</a> <h1>
      Boil Water Order Ends in Rochester    </h1>
<h2 class="h4">A water main break in Shelby Township forced residents to boil their drinking and cooking water two days ago. City officials lifted the 'boil order' around 2:30 p.m. today.</h2> <div class="clearfix summary-additional">
<span class="h6">By <a href="https://patch.com/users/kristin-bull">Kristin Bull, <span class="text-neutral">Patch Staff</span> </a> | <time datetime="2012-05-31 19:01:21">May 31, 2012 7:01 pm ET</time> | Updated <time datetime="2012-05-31 19:06:53">May 31, 2012 7:06 pm ET</time><a class="edit-p soft-hide gray-subtle-link" href="https://my.patch.com/article/4426067/edit" rel="nofollow" target="_blank" title="Moderate Content."><span class="separator"></span> <span aria-hidden="true" class="fal fa-paragraph fa-xs"></span></a></span><div class="flag-fb-like-wrapper air-xs-t"><div class="fb-like" data-action="like" data-href="https://patch.com/michigan/rochester/boil-water-order-ends-in-rochester" data-layout="button_count" data-share="true"></div></div> </div>
</div>
</section> <!-- /.block -->

Reddit" trigger="reddit"><span class="fab fa-2x fa-reddit-alien"></span></a><a alt="Send Email" category="social" class="social-btn social-btn-email hidden-xxs" href="mailto:?subject=Boil%20Water%20Order%20Ends%20in%20Rochester&body=Boil%20Water%20Order%20Ends%20in%20Rochester%0D%0A%0D%0AA%20water%20main%20break%20in%20Shelby%20Township%20forced%20residents%20to%20boil%20their%20drinking%20and%20cooking%20water%20two%20days%20ago.%20City%20officials%20lifted%20the%20%27boil%20order%27%20around%202%3A30%20p.m.%20today.%0D%0A%0D%0Ahttps://patch.com/michigan/rochester/boil-water-order-ends-in-rochester" title="Send Email" trigger="email"><span class="fa fa-2x fa-envelope"></span></a><a class="btn-comment-now social-btn social-btn-comments" href="#comments" title="View Comments for “Boil Water Order Ends in Rochester”"><span class="fa fa-2x fa-comments"></span><span class="disqus-comment-count p bold visible-lg-block visible-md-block visible-sm-block visible-xs-inline-block" data-disqus-identifier="4426067">0</span></a></div></div>
<div class="content-main-image">
<img alt="Boil Water Order Ends in Rochester" class="img-responsive center-block" src="https://cdn.patchcdn.com/users/52712/2012/05/T800x600/b3371e38d739e955a7b16984273cecff.jpg"/> </div>
<div class="content-body center-block" id="article-wrapper">
<p>Rochester city officials say it's now safe for residents who live east of Letica Drive to drink and cook with their tap water. </p> <p>A "boil water order" in effect since Tuesday was lifted on Thursday afternoon.</p> <p>The boil order happened after a 36-inch water main on 24 Mile Road between Schoenherr and Jewel roads broke just before noon Tuesday; shortly after, residents of Rochester's east side began reporting low water pressure, said City Manager Jaymes Vettraino.</p> <p>The water pressure was restored, and crews repaired the break. But because there is a risk for contaminants to siphon their way back into a water distribution system when that system loses pressure, public health officials advised residents to boil the water until a water test could be performed. </p> <p>The boil water order affected those living east of Letica Drive, including Village Green Apartments and Churchill Circle. </p><div id="in-article-boxed-recirc"><div class="text-center air-md"><a category="subscribe" class="btn btn-lg btn-cta-alt pill sans in-article-subscribe l-bold" href="/" trigger="article_button_click">   Subscribe  <span aria-hidden="true" class="fal fa-angle-right fa-lg"></span></a></div></div> </div>

Boil water advisory issued in Columbiana

  • |
  • Print
Tweet

Published: Thu, May 31, 2012 @ 2:54 p.m.

Boil water advisory issued in Columbiana

The City of Columbiana has issued a “boil advisory” from 600 to 702 Fairfield Avenue because of a water main break that occurred in that area. Red door hangers were left at each address affected by this advisory. This advisory will be in effect until water testing results are known and the water is deemed safe to drink.

NEW INFORMATION: Boil water advisory lifted in Hammond

Posted: Wed 4:24 PM, Jun 06, 2012 &nbsp|&nbsp
Updated: Wed 4:24 PM, Jun 06, 2012

HAMMOND, Wis. (WEAU) - A boil water advisory for an area village has been lifted.

On Wednesday, Chuck Fedie from Hammond's Public Works Department told WEAU 13 News that DNR testing had indicated that the village's water was back to normal.

Multiple tests in late May had indicated coliform bacteria in the water. The advisory had taken effect May 30.

-------------------------
Original Story:

HAMMOND, Wis. (WEAU)- If you live in the Village of Hammond, you need to start boiling your water or drink bottled water until further notice.

The Public Works Department says a water sample collected last Thursday showed the presence of coliform bacteria. Further sampling on Tuesday confirmed the bacteria. The department says it's emergency chlorinating the water system and will continue to test and monitor the system until the water is safe.

/*++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Skin name: mySkin
borderRadius: 5
background: rgb(255, 217, 102)
icons: rgb(68, 68, 68)
border: rgb(55, 55, 55)
borderLeft: rgb(255, 230, 153)
borderRight: rgb(255, 204, 51)
mute: rgba(68, 68, 68, 0.4)
download: rgba(255, 217, 102, 0.4)
downloadHover: rgb(255, 217, 102)
++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/

/* Older browser (IE8) - not supporting rgba() */
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span{background-color:#ffd966}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span.map_play{border-left:1px solid #ffd966;}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span.map_volume{border-right:1px solid #ffd966;}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span.map_volume.mute{color: #444444;}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .map_download{color: #444444;}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .map_download:hover{color: #444444;}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span{color: #444444;}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable {border: 1px solid #444444 !important;}

/*++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/

.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable{background-color:transparent; border-radius:5px !important;}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span{background-color:rgb(255, 217, 102); padding:3px !important; font-size: 20px;}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span.map_time{ font-size: 12px !important; width: 50px !important}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span.map_title{ padding:4px !important}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span.map_play{border-left:1px solid rgb(255, 204, 51); border-radius:0 4px 4px 0 !important;}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span.map_volume{padding-left:6px !important}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span.map_volume{border-right:1px solid rgb(255, 230, 153); border-radius:4px 0 0 4px !important;}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span.map_volume.mute{color: rgba(68, 68, 68, 0.4);}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .map_download{color: rgba(255, 217, 102, 0.4);}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .map_download:hover{color: rgb(255, 217, 102);}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span{color: rgb(68, 68, 68);text-shadow: none!important;}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span{color: rgb(68, 68, 68);}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable {border: 1px solid rgb(55, 55, 55) !important;}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span.map_title{color: #000; text-shadow:none!important}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable .jp-load-bar{background-color:rgba(255, 217, 102, 0.3);}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable .jp-play-bar{background-color:#ffd966;}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span.map_volumeLevel a{background-color:rgb(94, 94, 94); height:80%!important }

.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin  span.map_download{font-size:50px !important;}

    Boil advisory for part of Ashland

    by Jennifer Weiser

    Thu, 31 May 2012 03:55:00 GMT — 



    Update: Friday, June 1, 11:04 a.m.:


    According to the Ashland city officials, the Boil Order Advisory has been lifted for residents on Oak Street, Tandy Street, and Jackson Avenue. Water samples examined Friday morning were clear of contamination.

    Residents can resume using their normal water.



    Updated 11:45 a.m., 5/31/2012:




    Crews had the valve repaired and water service was restored at 10:30 p.m. to the roughly 50 homes affected by the broken valve.


    Customers will be notified with hang tags on their doors when the boil advisory has been lifted.

    Original:

    A broken water main in Ashland has lead the city's public works department to put out a boil advisory for the residents of three streets. The main broke Wednesday evening on East Broadway, but the advisory is for people living on Oak Street, Tandy Street and Johnson Avenue.


    It is a precautionary boil order. Residents should boil water for three minutes before using it for drinking or cooking. Also, do not use ice from an automatic ice maker. You can disinfect dishes and food contact surfaces by putting them in clean tap water with one teaspoon of unscented bleach per gallon of water.


    Public works needs to have two clean water samples before they lift the order. That will take 48 hours, at the minimum.

<p>CHARLESTON, W.Va. -- West Virginia American Water has lifted a boil-water advisory for approximately 90 residential customers in the <strong>Pea Ridge</strong> area of Huntington. The advisory was issued for customers on Aracoma Road, Aracoma Drive, Baker Road, Benton Court, Morgan Place, Pineview Drive, Pinedale Drive and part of Highland Drive after a water main break.</p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><li>nn</li><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-608360">

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });

News Feed Item

Drinkable Air Mounts Public Awareness Campaign: Free Water to Broward Residents Affected by Boil Water Alerts

By Marketwired .
Article Rating:
May 30, 2012 09:30 AM EDT
Reads:
 219
  • Related
  • Print
  • Email
  • Feedback
  • Add This
  • Blog This

FORT LAUDERDALE, FL -- (Marketwire) -- 05/30/12 -- Drinkable Air is mounting a public awareness and support campaign committing to dispense free fresh water once a boil water alert is issued. The free water is available throughout the day or at specific times depending on the urgency or need.

Future plans include mobilizing, then dispatching to affected neighborhoods, Drinkable Air's Chameleon 1200 atmospheric water generator to make up to 2000 gallons of water a day. Currently, the Company will use their Chameleon 60's and a generator to create up to 100 gallons a day on site. Fort Lauderdale's Dr. Benjamin Chavis, consultant and Advisory Board Member to Drinkable Air distributor Energy Edge Technology Corp. (OTCBB: EEDG), Lt. General Russell Honoré, and Southern University in Baton Rouge are developing the Disaster Relief vehicle that will incorporate solar and wind to supply the system with energy. Drinkable Air is also developing a solar application to its Chameleon 8 line that will be available for installation prior to the hurricane season.

Drinkable Air's innovative, patented technology converts moisture from the atmosphere into an unlimited supply of pure drinking water. The Company offers a wide variety of Chameleon water generating systems for individual needs as well as commercial and industrial use. www.drinkable-air.com

Drinkable Air implemented the public awareness and support program after the recent boil alert was issued this Memorial Day weekend. Although not aware of the exact number of boil alerts that have been posted in the past year, it is noted that one was recently declared on Christmas Eve. Unaware of when the next emergency water situation will occur, the Company is positioning itself to support Broward County residents through every water emergency.

Contradicting the suggestion to buy bottled water Jeff Szur, Co-Founder of Drinkable Air, states, "Buying plastic bottles of water only increases the consumers' waste and carbon footprint while decreasing the 'green' in the consumers' pockets. We want to educate the public making them aware that it's easy to fill pre-existing household containers with pure Drinkable Air Water from one of our Chameleons. If our water generator was in your home it would reduce waste, save money, and keep you prepared for the next boil alert and the upcoming hurricane season. Be prepared for water emergencies. Stop by our plant to see what Drinkable Air is all about."

Drinkable Air is located at:
2944 NW 27th Street - Bldg. #14
Lauderdale Lakes, FL 33311

All the World’s a Cloud
All of Cloud Is at Cloud Expo!
Cloud Computing - Big Data | Analytics - Internet of Things
Containers - Microservices - WebRTC - DevOps

Join Us at the Javits Center in New York, NY, June 6-8

Cloud computing software is eating the world, and each day is bringing new developments in this world.

Yesterday's debate about public vs. private has transformed into the reality of hybrid cloud: a recent survey shows that 74% of enterprises have a hybrid cloud strategy.

Meanwhile, 94% of enterprises are using some form of XaaS – software, platform, and Infrastructure as a Service.

Big Data | Analytics and the emerging Internet of Things (IoT) are driving exponentially increased demands on datacenters and developers alike, as we cross the zettabyte horizon this year.

Containers and microservices are now part of every PaaS conversation, and IaaS providers are increasingly competing for platform customers.

WebRTC continues to reform web communications, and DevOps is pushing its way into an enterprise IT world that is increasingly agile, lean, and continuous.

Through all this, Cloud Expo remains the single independent event where delegates and technology vendors can meet to experience and discuss the entire world of the cloud.

Only Cloud Expo brings together all this in a single location:
    • Cloud Computing
    • Big Data | Analytics
    • Internet of Things
    • Containers | Microservices
    • WebRTC
    • DevOps

Cloud computing budgets worldwide are reaching into the hundreds of billions of dollars, and no organization can survive long without some sort of cloud migration strategy. Each month brings new announcements, use cases, and success stories.

Cloud Expo offers the world's most comprehensive selection of technical and strategic Industry Keynotes, General Sessions, Breakout Sessions, and signature Power Panels. The exhibition floor features 100+ exhibitors offering specific solutions and comprehensive strategies.

The floor also features a Demo Theater that give delegates the opportunity to get even closer to the technology they want to see and the people who offer it.

Attend Cloud Expo. Create your own custom experience. Learn the latest from the world's best technologists. Talk to the vendors you are considering, and put them to the test.

See you in New York!

  • DevOps
  • Cloud
  • WebRTC
  • IoT

<a class="h6 gray-dark-link text-capitalize block-display air-xxs" href="https://patch.com/michigan/rochester/politics">politics & government</a> <h1>
      Rochester's East Side Under 'Boil Water' Order for Next 2 Days    </h1>
<h2 class="h4">Residents east of Letica must boil drinking or cooking water for the next 48 hours after water main break on 24 Mile Road.</h2> <div class="clearfix summary-additional">
<span class="h6">By <a href="https://patch.com/users/kristin-bull">Kristin Bull, <span class="text-neutral">Patch Staff</span> </a> | <time datetime="2012-05-29 18:27:05">May 29, 2012 6:27 pm ET</time> | Updated <time datetime="2012-05-29 19:12:59">May 29, 2012 7:12 pm ET</time><a class="edit-p soft-hide gray-subtle-link" href="https://my.patch.com/article/4403528/edit" rel="nofollow" target="_blank" title="Moderate Content."><span class="separator"></span> <span aria-hidden="true" class="fal fa-paragraph fa-xs"></span></a></span><div class="flag-fb-like-wrapper air-xs-t"><div class="fb-like" data-action="like" data-href="https://patch.com/michigan/rochester/rochester-s-east-side-under-boil-water-order-for-next-2-days" data-layout="button_count" data-share="true"></div></div> </div>

<div class="content-main-image">
<img alt="Rochester's East Side Under 'Boil Water' Order for Next 2 Days" class="img-responsive center-block" src="https://cdn.patchcdn.com/users/52712/2012/05/T800x600/b3371e38d739e955a7b16984273cecff.jpg"/> </div>
<div class="slideshow-carousel ">
<ul class="list-inline"><li class="first"><img alt="Rochester's East Side Under 'Boil Water' Order for Next 2 Days-0" class="img-responsive article-slideshow-image" data-lazy-pseudo="https://cdn.patchcdn.com/users/52712/2012/05/T800x600/b3371e38d739e955a7b16984273cecff.jpg" src="https://cdn.patchcdn.com/users/52712/2012/05/T200x150/b3371e38d739e955a7b16984273cecff.jpg" width="80"/></li>
<li class="last"><img alt="Rochester's East Side Under 'Boil Water' Order for Next 2 Days-1" class="img-responsive article-slideshow-image" data-lazy-pseudo="https://cdn.patchcdn.com/users/52712/2012/05/T800x600/d3f19ba38d3129aa9901d0e1525c8fed.jpg" src="https://cdn.patchcdn.com/users/52712/2012/05/T200x150/d3f19ba38d3129aa9901d0e1525c8fed.jpg" width="80"/></li>
</ul> </div>
<div class="content-body center-block" id="article-wrapper">
<p>A water main break in Shelby Township on Tuesday afternoon forced the city of Rochester to issue a boil water notice for the city's east side for at least the next 48 hours, city officials said.</p> <p>A 36-inch water main on 24 Mile Road between Schoenherr and Jewel roads broke just before noon Tuesday; shortly after, residents of Rochester's east side began reporting low water pressure, said City Manager Jaymes Vettraino.</p> <p>The water pressure has been restored, and crews are working to repair the break. But because there is a risk for contaminants to siphon their way back into a water distribution system when that system loses pressure, public health officials advise residents to boil the water until a water test is performed. </p> <p>The boil water order affects those living east of Letica Drive, including Village Green Apartments and Churchill Circle. </p> <p>The boil water order does not affect any of the downtown restaurants or other businesses.</p> <p>If you are affected by the boil water order, here's what you need to know:</p> <ul> <li>Vigorously boil water for five minutes before using it for drinking or cooking.</li> <li>If you can't boil the water, use bottled water.</li> <li>If you need help, or if you need bottled water, contact the Rochester Fire Department at 248-651-4470. The department has a supply of bottled water for those in need.</li> <li>After 48 hours, check with Rochester Patch, the <a href="http://www.ci.rochester.mi.us/" rel="nofollow">city's website</a> or on Channel 10 (WOW) or Channel 17 (Comcast) to see if the boil water order has been lifted.</li> </ul> <p>A boil water order has also been issued for Shelby Township residents.</p> <p>Channe 7, WXYZ, has <a href="http://www.wxyz.com/dpp/news/region/macomb_county/major-water-main-break-in-shelby-township" rel="nofollow">video of the water main site</a>. ClickOnDetroit has aerial photos of the <a href="http://www.clickondetroit.com/news/-/1719418/14268510/-/j4wfjy/-/index.html" rel="nofollow">water main break here</a>.</p><div id="in-article-boxed-recirc"><div class="text-center air-md"><a category="subscribe" class="btn btn-lg btn-cta-alt pill sans in-article-subscribe l-bold" href="/" trigger="article_button_click">   Subscribe  <span aria-hidden="true" class="fal fa-angle-right fa-lg"></span></a></div></div> </div>

Precautionary Boil Water Notice Issued For Parts Of Broward County

Officials said people shouldn't drink the water without boiling it first

    NEWSLETTERS

    Receive the latest local updates in your inbox

    Privacy policy | More Newsletters

    A precautionary boil water notice remained for parts of Broward County after a potable raw water well tested positive for a fecal indicator, officials said.

    On Saturday, Deerfield Beach officials those that receive water from the City of Deerfield Beach are not under the advisory. They said only consumers serviced by Broward County Water are under a boil water alert.

    The water plant, which serves Broward County Water and Wastewater Services in Pompano Beach, Deerfield Beach, Lighthouse Point and Coconut Creek detected the fecal indicator, which are microbes that indicate the water could have human or animal waste.

    The well is no longer in service. Officials said additional samples will be taken from the well on Saturday and Sunday and the boil water notice will probably be rescinded on Monday.

    Weird News Photos: Man Shoves Snake in Pants

    Officials said people shouldn't drink the water without boiling it first. It must come to a rolling boil and be boiled for one minute.

    People with severely compromised immune systems, infants or the elderly may be at more of a risk and should consult medical professionals.

    Call 1-800-426-4791 for the EPA's Safe Drinking Water Hotline.

    Weird News Photos: Holiday Edition

Crook water users ordered to boil water

Posted:   05/24/2012 03:54:31 PM MDT

The boil water order sent to the town of Crook by the Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment May 24
A broken drinking water line that created a complete loss of pressure has led to a boil order for those using the town of Crook's water system. It is standard for the state to issue such orders any time a loss of pressure occurs in a drinking water system, said Mark Salley, communications director of the Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment.
According to Deanna Herbert, public information officer for the Northeast Colorado Health Department, the state-issued boil order will remain in place until test results return that show the water is safe to drink.
NCHD has fact sheets posted on their website,
Fact sheet from the Northeast Colorado Health Department on the Crook boil order
org">www.nchd.org , with more information about the boil order.

    Corps closed Piney Bay Swim Beach until further notice

    LITTLE ROCK, AR, UNITED STATES

    05.24.2012

    Story by Laurie Driver 

    U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Little Rock District

    ✔ ✗ Subscribe
    2

    RUSSELLVILLE, Ark. – The Army Corps of Engineers, Russellville Project Office has closed the swimming area at Piney Bay Park located on Lake Dardanelle, until further notice. The closure is the result of higher than acceptable E-Coli levels that were found during routine testing conducted by the Arkansas Department of Health.

    Testing will continue on a daily basis, and the swimming beach will be re-opened as soon as test results indicate it is safe to do so.

    Corps officials are working to determine the source of the higher levels, but believe the unseasonably high temperatures and lack of rainfall are contributing factors.

    For more information, please contact the Russellville Project Office at 479-968-5008. Recreation information can be found on the Internet at www.swl.usace.army.mil, Facebook at
    www.facebook.com/littlerockusace, and Twitter at https://twitter.com/#!/usacelittlerock.

	//Generic method to read cookie
	function readCookie(name){
		var nameEQ=name+"=";
		var ca=document.cookie.split(';');
		for(var i=0; i<ca.length;i++){
		  var c=ca[i];
		  while(c.charAt(0)==' ') c=c.substring(1,c.length);
		  if(c.indexOf(nameEQ)==0) return c.substring(nameEQ.length,c.length);
	}
		return null;
	};
	//Turn lsg cookie into an array to be use with sectionKeywords param
	function lgAptGetSectionKeywords(){
		//Read lsg cookie
		var lsg=readCookie('lsg');
		var lgApt=new Array();
		if(lsg){
		  //Tokenize
		  var cookieTokens=lsg.split('s');
	
		  //Fill APT keywords array
		  for(var i=0;i <cookieTokens.length; i++){
			if(cookieTokens[i]!='0') lgApt.push(cookieTokens[i]);
		  }
		}
		return lgApt;
	};
</script>

<div class="card-container">
<div class="card-body">
<div class="card-headline">
<h3 class="">
<a href="/life/health/on-health-december-awareness-highlights/article_c322fc05-5abf-5360-80e6-f1fc1520a849.html">
        

        
        ON HEALTH: December awareness highlights</a></h3>
</div>
<div class="card-lead">
<p>Each month has special designations. Some are more well-known than others. While there are also many highlights to which we should perhaps pay special attention. Throughout December we may see more ads, read more articles or hear lots of information about both Colitis and Crohn’s disease. Both of these issues are conditions that impact our colon. Sadly, no one likes to talk about our colon or bowels, or things like diarrhea. However, these are serious conditions that can make life very uncomfortable. These are issues that need to be discussed with your primary care physician and perhaps with a specialist if they are ongoing and need special treatment. Both are treatable!</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="clearfix"></div>
</article>
</div>
</section>

<div class="asset-content subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<p>A boil water alert has been issued for Ira Township residents on certain streets in the community until 4 p.m. Thursday.</p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-1343209"><div class="ndn_embed" data-config-aspect-ratio="16:9" data-config-distributor-id="91743" data-config-width="100%" id="inform-perfectpixel-mid"></div></div></div><p>According to an employee at the township offices, residents living on Belle Brae Road, Bouvier Bay Road, Belleau Road, Denstaedt Court, Lake Park Avenue, Lake Park Drive, Lakeview Drive and Sunnyside Avenue are being asked to boil their water. This warning came Tuesday morning when two water mains in the township broke.</p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-1300388"><!--cube article only--><div class="block text-center" id="DFM-adPos-article">
<script>googletag.cmd.push(function() {googletag.display('DFM-adPos-article');});</script>
</div></div></div><p>Residents are asked to boil their water to avoid any possible bacteria that could have made its way into the water source at time.</p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-1343210"><div class="ndn_embed" data-config-aspect-ratio="16:9" data-config-distributor-id="91743" data-config-width="100%" id="inform-perfectpixel-bottom"></div></div></div>
</div>

<h4 class="">

        Will the deal between Enbridge and the state of Michigan be enough to protect the Great Lakes or should the pipeline, which carries up to 540,000 barrels of crude oil across the Straits of Mackinac and the St. Clair River each day, have been decommissioned?</a></h4>
<div class="poll-content" id="poll-77e0737e-d7d6-11e7-a6db-cb0b0bf7b6c1-1278740">
<div class="loading-poll hide-onload text-center"><i class="fa fa-spinner fa-2x fa-spin"></i></div>

</div>
<div id="poll-77e0737e-d7d6-11e7-a6db-cb0b0bf7b6c1-1278740-results" style="display: none;"></div>
<div id="poll-77e0737e-d7d6-11e7-a6db-cb0b0bf7b6c1-1278740-container">
<form action="/opinion/will-the-deal-between-enbridge-and-the-state-of-michigan/poll_77e0737e-d7d6-11e7-a6db-cb0b0bf7b6c1.html" id="poll-77e0737e-d7d6-11e7-a6db-cb0b0bf7b6c1-1278740-form" method="post" role="form">
<div class="radio">
<label>
<input name="answer" title="The deal is enough" type="radio" value="C7C80377-0CE0-0001-83C01CEB32101B12"/> The deal is enough
                                </label>
</div>
<div class="radio">
<label>
<input name="answer" title="The deal is a good start, but more is needed" type="radio" value="C7C80378-63E0-0001-FADD16D012501BBE"/> The deal is a good start, but more is needed
                                </label>
</div>
<div class="radio">
<label>
<input name="answer" title="The pipeline should be decommissioned" type="radio" value="C7C8037C-E160-0001-117318601F5B8E50"/> The pipeline should be decommissioned
                                </label>
</div>
<div class="radio">
<label>
<input name="answer" title="I’m not sure" type="radio" value="C7C8037F-1460-0001-593F141018C72700"/> I’m not sure
                                </label>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){

                });

Fulton Boil Water Order is Lifted; Tap Water is Safe to Use

Written by Dave Bullard, May 23, 2012, Comments Off

JUST IN: Fulton officials have lifted the boil water order in place since Saturday.

City water has passed two days of water quality tests and is now safe to use for cooking, washing and drinking.

The boil water order was imposed after a cave-in on a major city well was discovered Saturday.  The well has since been removed from the city water supply while officials look for a way to fix it.

Here’s the city’s press release, below:

City of Fulton water customers were notified on Saturday, May 19, 2012 of a problem with one of the City wells and were advised to first boil their water before using it. We are pleased to report it is no longer necessary to boil the water before using it. We apologize for any inconvenience and thank you for your patience.

As always, you may contact Chief Operator John Florek at the Fulton Water Works, 592-7152 or 402-6074, DPW Commissioner Dan O’Brien at 402-6125, or the Oswego County Health Department at 341-0086 with any comments or questions.

/* Content
----------------------------------------------- */
body {
font: normal normal 14px Arial, Tahoma, Helvetica, FreeSans, sans-serif;
color: #000000;
background: #ffffff none repeat scroll top left;
padding: 0 0 0 0;
}
html body .region-inner {
min-width: 0;
max-width: 100%;
width: auto;
}
a:link {
text-decoration:none;
color: #2288bb;
}
a:visited {
text-decoration:none;
color: #888888;
}
a:hover {
text-decoration:underline;
color: #33aaff;
}
.body-fauxcolumn-outer .fauxcolumn-inner {
background: transparent none repeat scroll top left;
_background-image: none;
}
.body-fauxcolumn-outer .cap-top {

width: 100%;

.body-fauxcolumn-outer .cap-top .cap-left {

}
.content-outer {

<a name="8333807645102011268"></a>
<h3 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name">
Boil Water Notice Near Satellite Beach
</h3>
<div class="post-header">
<div class="post-header-line-1"></div>
</div>
<div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-8333807645102011268" itemprop="description articleBody">
<div id="text1" style="font-family: Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; text-align: justify;">
<div id="title">
<span style="font-size: small;">SATELLITE BEACH, Florida -- The City of Melbourne has issued the following precautionary boil water notice for residents in a neighborhood just north of incorporated Satellite Beach, Florida:</span></div>
<div id="title">
<span style="font-size: small;"> </span></div>
<div id="title">
<span style="font-size: small;"> </span></div>
<div id="title">
<span style="font-size: small;">PRECAUTIONARY BOIL WATER NOTICE - May 22, 2012</span></div>
<span style="font-size: small;">TO: The residents of unincorporated Brevard County (north of Satellite Beach) at the following addresses: </span><br/>
<ul type="square">
<li><span style="font-size: small;">327 – 356 South Lakeside Drive</span></li>
<li><span style="font-size: small;">409 – 461 South Waterway Drive</span></li>
<li><span style="font-size: small;">332 – 348 South Point Court </span></li>
</ul>
<span style="font-size: small;"><br/></span>
<span style="font-size: small;">Water has been shut off to your property while a repair is
made to a broken water main in your area.  Therefore, as a precaution,
we advise that once water service is re-established all water used for
drinking, cooking, making ice, brushing teeth, or washing dishes, be
boiled. A rolling boil of one minute is sufficient. As an alternative,
bottled water may be used.</span><br/>
<br/>
<br/>
<span style="font-size: small;">This precautionary boil water notice is expected to remain in
effect until Thursday, May 24.  It will be lifted when the required
bacteriological survey shows that the water is safe to drink.  You will
be provided with a notification at that time.</span><br/>
<br/>
<br/>
<span style="font-size: small;">If you have any questions, you may contact City of Melbourne
Public Works & Utilities Administration office at (321) 674-5761,
or the after-hours emergency number of (321) 255-4622.
</span></div>
<div style="clear: both;"></div>
</div>

                        var url = url + '&template=mwdt';
                    window.location = url;
                    }
                else
                    {
                    var domain = '/';
                    // Mobile-enabled sites only:
                        window.location = domain + 'section/mwdt01';
                    }
                }
            function mobilesite_confirm()
                {
                var mresponse = confirm('It appears you are using a mobile device. Would you like to visit the mobile site?');
                return mresponse;
                }
            function clearsiteviewcookie()
                {
                var expiredate = new Date();
                expiredate.setDate(expiredate.getDate() - 500);
                document.cookie = 'siteview=; expires=' +expiredate+ '; path=/';
                }
            function setsiteviewcookie(val)
                {
                var expiredate = new Date();
                expiredate.setDate(expiredate.getDate() + 500);
                document.cookie = 'siteview=' +val+ '; expires=' +expiredate+ '; path=/';
                }
            // Mobile-enabled sites only:
            var isMobile =
                {
                Android: function()
                    {
                    return navigator.userAgent.match(/Android/i);
                    },
                BlackBerry: function()
                    {
                    return navigator.userAgent.match(/BlackBerry/i);
                    },
                iOS: function()
                    {
                    return navigator.userAgent.match(/iPhone|iPad|iPod/i);
                    },
                iPhone: function()
                    {
                    return navigator.userAgent.match(/iPhone|iPod/i);
                    },
                iPad: function()
                    {
                    return navigator.userAgent.match(/iPad/i);
                    },
                Opera: function()
                    {
                    return navigator.userAgent.match(/Opera Mini/i);
                    },
                Windows: function()
                    {
                    return navigator.userAgent.match(/IEMobile/i);
                    },
                any: function()
                    {
                    return (isMobile.Android() || isMobile.BlackBerry() || isMobile.iOS() || isMobile.Opera() || isMobile.Windows());
                    }
                };
            if (getcookie('siteview') != 'full')
                {
                if (getcookie('siteview') == 'mobile')
                    {
                    mobilesite_redirect();
                    }
                else
                    {
                    if (isMobile.any())
                        {
                        if (mobilesite_confirm())
                            {
                            // set siteview cookie = mobile
                            var expiredate = new Date();
                            expiredate.setDate(expiredate.getDate() + 500);
                            document.cookie = 'siteview=mobile; expires=' +expiredate+ '; path=/';
                            mobilesite_redirect();
                            }
                        else
                            {
                            // set siteview cookie = full
                            var expiredate = new Date();
                            expiredate.setDate(expiredate.getDate() + 500);
                            document.cookie = 'siteview=full; expires=' +expiredate+ '; path=/';
                            }
                        }
                    }
                }
        </script>

<script>
function swipedetect(el, callback)
    {
    var touchsurface = el,
        swipedir,
        startX,
        startY,
        distX,
        distY,
        threshold = 150,
        restraint = 100,
        allowedTime = 300,
        elapsedTime,
        startTime,
        handleswipe = callback || function(swipedir){};
    touchsurface.addEventListener('touchstart', function(e)
        {
        var touchobj = e.changedTouches[0];
        swipedir = 'none';
        dist = 0;
        startX = touchobj.pageX;
        startY = touchobj.pageY;
        startTime = new Date().getTime();
        e.preventDefault();
        }, false);
    touchsurface.addEventListener('touchmove', function(e)
        {
        e.preventDefault();
        }, false);
    touchsurface.addEventListener('touchend', function(e)
        {
        var touchobj = e.changedTouches[0];
        distX = touchobj.pageX - startX;
        distY = touchobj.pageY - startY;
        elapsedTime = new Date().getTime() - startTime;
        if (elapsedTime <= allowedTime)
            {
            if (Math.abs(distX) >= threshold && Math.abs(distY) <= restraint)
                {
                swipedir = (distX < 0) ? 'left' : 'right';
                }
            else if (Math.abs(distY) >= threshold && Math.abs(distX) <= restraint)
                {
                swipedir = (distY < 0) ? 'up' : 'down';
                }
            }
        handleswipe(swipedir);
        e.preventDefault();
        }, false);
    }
var el = document.getElementById('dp_image_box');
swipedetect (el, function(swipedir)
    {
    if (swipedir == 'left')
        {
        set_dp_image('prev');
        }
    else if (swipedir == 'right')
        {
        set_dp_image('next');
        }
    });

<p>A waterline break Monday night on Route 37 in Pamelia that likely was caused by a construction company that misused a fire hydrant could cost the town anywhere from $10,000 to $20,000 in repairs.<br/><br/>About 50 customers lost water service with the break, which was reported at 9 p.m. south of Route 342.<br/><br/>Officials found another break in the line about a half mile south Monday night  across from Willowbrook Golf Course  and a third break a half mile farther south was reported at 4 a.m. Tuesday.<br/><br/>Workers from P&T Water Supply & Services, Watertown, repaired the lines to restore service by 2 p.m. Tuesday.<br/><br/>The state Department of Health issued a boil-water advisory for residents in water districts four and five because of possible contamination from the break. Residents are advised to boil water used for drinking and cooking until the advisory is lifted, which likely will happen today after the department conducts testing.<br/><br/>Pamelia Highway Superintendent Dennis G. Hoistion said the town has contracts with three local construction companies that routinely draw water from fire hydrants. The problem likely was caused by a construction worker who turned off the valves on a hydrant too quickly, creating a buildup of pressure that broke the line. The additional breaks in the line probably were caused by pressure that accumulated from the first break.<br/><br/>I dont think that it was a freak accident, he said. We suspect that someone turned off the hydrant too fast and created a water hammer, which happens when water doesnt have anywhere to go and builds up pressure. Thats what probably popped the joints apart.<br/><br/>Mr. Hoistion said that he plans to talk with town officials about how to prevent future problems. The town could offer workers training on how to operate the hydrants, or it could decide to ban them from using them. Either way, Mr. Hoistion said, waterline breaks are a costly expense for taxpayers to support.<br/><br/>I hope the town will give me direction on what to do, he said. Either we coach them how to (use the hydrants), or make them completely stop.<br/><br/>Residents with questions about the boil-water advisory can call the town office at 785-9793.</p>

<script>
for (var i=0; i<dp_image.length; i++)
    {

        {

        dp_thumb[i] = new Image();
        dp_thumb[i].src = 'http://img.youtube.com/vi/' +dp_video_id[i]+ '/default.jpg';

    else

function set_dp_image(type)
    {
    for (var i=0; i<dp_image.length; i++)
        {
        document.getElementById('dp_thumb_' + i).style.backgroundColor = '#FFF';
        document.getElementById('dp_thumb_' + i).style.borderColor = '#369';
        }
    if (dp_image.length > 0)
        {
        if (dp_image.length == 1)
            {
            document.getElementById('dp_thumb_container').style.display = 'none';
            }
        if (type == 'init')
            {
            dp_id = 0;
            }
        else if (type == 'next')
            {
            dp_id++;
            if (dp_id == dp_image.length)
                {
                dp_id = 0;
                }
            }
        else if (type == 'prev')
            {
            dp_id--;
            if (dp_id < 0)
                {
                dp_id = dp_image.length - 1;
                }
            }
        else
            {
            dp_id = type;
            }
        document.getElementById('dp_image_count').innerHTML = 'Item ' + (dp_id + 1) + ' of ' + dp_image.length;
        if (dp_media[dp_id] === 'image')
            {
            document.getElementById('dp_image_box').innerHTML = '';
            document.getElementById('dp_image_box').style.backgroundImage = "url('" +dp_img[dp_id].src+ "')";
            }
        else if (dp_media[dp_id].toUpperCase() === 'YOUTUBE')
            {
            document.getElementById('dp_image_box').innerHTML = dp_image[dp_id];
            document.getElementById('dp_image_box').style.backgroundImage = "none";
            }
        document.getElementById('dp_caption_box').innerHTML = '<div class="credit">' +dp_credit[dp_id]+ '</div><div class="caption">' +dp_caption[dp_id]+ '</div>';
        document.getElementById('dp_thumb_' + dp_id).style.backgroundColor = 'rgba(255,255,255,0.75)'; //'rgba(51,102,153,0.25)';
        document.getElementById('dp_thumb_' + dp_id).style.borderColor = 'rgba(255,255,255,1)';
        document.getElementById('dp_thumb_box').scrollLeft = dp_id * 93;
        //document.getElementById('dp_share_box').innerHTML = '<div style="float: left; margin-right: 5px;">Share</div><a href="http://twitter.com/share?text=' +encodeURIComponent(dp_title[dp_id])+ '&url=' +window.location.protocol+window.location.host+dp_link[dp_id]+ '" target="_blank" style="display: block; float: left; width: 20px; height: 20px; background: #FFF url(\'/images/dp_share_twitter.png\') center center no-repeat;" title="Share this image/story on Twitter"></a><a href="http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=' +window.location.protocol+window.location.host+dp_link[dp_id]+ '" target="_blank" style="display: block; float: left; width: 20px; height: 20px; background: #FFF url(\'/images/dp_share_facebook.png\') center center no-repeat;" title="Share this image/story on Facebook"></a><div class="break"></div>';
        }
    else
        {
        //document.getElementById('dp_image_box').innerHTML = '<div style="font: 600 18px \'open sans\', sans-serif; color: #FFF;">No photos to display today.</div>';
        document.getElementById('dp_image_block').style.display = 'none';
        }
    }
function set_dp_thumbs()
    {
    var thumb_strip_width = dp_image.length * 93;
    var thumb_content = '<div id="dp_thumb_strip" style="width: ' +thumb_strip_width+ 'px;">';
    for (var i=0; i<dp_image.length; i++)
        {
        thumb_content += '<div id="dp_thumb_' +i+ '" class="dp_thumb" onclick="set_dp_image(' +i+ ');" style="background: transparent url(\'' +dp_thumb[i].src+ '\') center center no-repeat;"></div>';
        }
    thumb_content += '</div>';
    document.getElementById('dp_thumb_box').innerHTML = thumb_content;
    }
set_dp_thumbs();
set_dp_image('init');
window.onkeydown = function(e)
    {
    var key = e.keyCode ? e.keyCode : e.which;
    if (key == 37)
        {
        set_dp_image('prev');
        e.preventDefault();
        return false;
        }
    else if (key == 39)
        {
        set_dp_image('next');
        e.preventDefault;
        return false;
        }
    }

(function()
    {
    var dowarr = ['Sunday','Monday','Tuesday','Wednesday','Thursday','Friday','Saturday'];
    var dlabel = '';
    var dnow = new Date();
    var d = new Date();
    var datecode = 'See photos for <select onchange="window.location = window.location.pathname + \'?gallerydate=\' + this.options[this.selectedIndex].value;">';
    //datecode += '<option value=""></option>';
    var gdate = getqsvar('gallerydate');
    var selval = '';
    for (var i=0; i<7; i++)
        {
        d.setTime(dnow.getTime() - (i*86400000));
        dyear = d.getFullYear();
        dmonth = d.getMonth() + 1;
        dmonth_f = ('0' + dmonth).slice(-2);
        ddate = d.getDate();
        ddate_f = ('0' + ddate).slice(-2);
        if (i == 0)
            {
            dlabel = 'Today';
            selval = ((gdate == +dyear+ '-' +dmonth_f+ '-' +ddate_f+ 'Z') || (gdate == '')) ? ' selected' : '';
            }
        else if (i == 1)
            {
            dlabel = 'Yesterday';
            selval = (gdate == +dyear+ '-' +dmonth_f+ '-' +ddate_f+ 'Z') ? ' selected' : '';
            }
        else
            {
            dlabel = dowarr[d.getDay()];
            selval = (gdate == +dyear+ '-' +dmonth_f+ '-' +ddate_f+ 'Z') ? ' selected' : '';
            }
        datecode += '<option value="' +dyear+ '-' +dmonth_f+ '-' +ddate_f+ 'Z"' +selval+ '>' +dlabel+ '</option>';
        }
    datecode += '</select>';
    document.getElementById('dp_date_box').innerHTML = datecode;
    })();
function getqsvar(varname)
    {
    var qs = window.location.search.substring(1);
    var pairs = qs.split('&');
    for (var i = 0; i < pairs.length; i++)
        {
        var nvp = pairs[i].split('=');
        if (decodeURIComponent(nvp[0]) == varname)
            {
            return decodeURIComponent(nvp[1]);
            }
        }
    return '';
    }
</script>

<h1 style="font: 36px bevan, serif; color: #833; padding: 0; margin: 0;">Thank you!</h1>
<div class="article_body">
<p>Thousands of readers like you have made Northern New York Newspapers the number one ranked website* for local news and sports coverage in the north country.</p>
<p>You can continue on to this article in a few seconds, or you can visit one of our websites:</p>
<ul>

<li><a href="http://mpcourier.com/">Daily Courier-Observer</a></li>

<div class="card-body">

<a href="/news/trump-flouts-warnings-declares-jerusalem-israel-s-capital/article_79b70952-dab9-11e7-a66a-1b91adeea8c6.html">
        

        
        Trump flouts warnings, declares Jerusalem Israel's capital</a></h3>
</div>
<div class="card-lead">
<p>Trump also directed the State Department begin the process of moving the U.S. Embassy from Tel Aviv to Jerusalem as required by U.S. law. Officials said, however, that the move will take years to complete.</p>

<p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">A boil order for Fairmont residents has been lifted.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Mayor Phil Luginbill said Monday the order from Oklahoma Department of Environmental Quality was lifted Friday.</p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">ODEQ imposed the boil order May 7 after traces of E. coli were found in the town’s water supply. An electrical problem caused the chlorine pump to not work properly, Luginbill said. That problem has been solved, he said, and town workers took a sample to send to ODEQ. The town also sent notices to its water users, as directed by ODEQ.</p>
<p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">ODEQ spokeswoman Skylar McElhaney said E. coli can cause gastrointestinal issues, resulting in frequent trips to the bathroom. Young children and older adults could experience extreme symptoms including abdominal cramping, nausea and vomiting.</p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"><div class="tncms-block visible-xs" id="tncms-block-1113625">
<!-- Mobile Rectangle ATF 300x250 article -->
<div class="visible-xs visible-sm" id="mobileRectangle_atf" style="width:100%;text-align:center">
<script type="text/javascript">
AdBridg.cmd.push(function() { AdBridg.display('mobileRectangle_atf'); });
</script>
</div>
<div class="clear" style="padding-bottom:10px"></div>
</div></div><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">The advisory ODEQ issued had informed residents to bring water to a full, rolling boil for at least one minute before using. The order applied to water for drinking, food preparation, dishwashing and brushing teeth.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">###</p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"></div>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 30;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 30) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 30);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>
</div>

<div id="WNStoryHeader">
<h3 class="">Boil water advisory after Cape main break</h3>
<em class="wnDate">Posted: 
<script type="text/javascript">
                                wnRenderDate('Thursday, May 17, 2012 9:22 AM EDT', '', false);</script>
</em><noscript><em class="wnDate">Thursday, May 17, 2012 9:22 AM EDT</em></noscript><!--END wnDate-->
<em class="wnDate">Updated: 
<script type="text/javascript">
                                wnRenderDate('Thursday, May 17, 2012 4:27 PM EDT', '', false);</script>
</em><noscript><em class="wnDate">Thursday, May 17, 2012 4:27 PM EDT</em></noscript><!--END wnDate-->
<style>time.prefixdate:before{content:'Posted: ';}time.prefixdate:before{content:'Updated: ';}</style><div class="debug hide" data-debug="Display Size 37 attempting to load..."></div></div><!--END WNStoryHeader-->
<div class="wnRight" id="WNStoryRelatedBox" wncollapse="true"><div class="debug hide" data-debug="Display Size 20 attempting to load..."></div><div class="wnStoryBodyGraphic wnImageWidth-180"><img alt="" border="0" src="http://wbbh.images.worldnow.com/images/18484763_BG1.jpg" title="" width="180"/>
</div><div class="wnad wnad20" id="WNAd20">
<script>wnad_20.load();</script></div>
<!--END wnAdSize-->
</div>
<script type="text/javascript">if (Worldnow.EventMan) Worldnow.EventMan.event('WNStoryRelatedBoxdone');</script>
<!--END WNStoryRelatedBox-->
<div class=" withRelated right" id="WNStoryBody"><span id="WNStoryDateline">LEE COUNTY, Fla. -
            </span><p></p>
<p>This morning's water main break in Cape Coral created a traffic nightmare for drivers.  </p>
<p>City crews have been repairing the main break at the intersection of Del Prado Blvd. and Veteran Parkway since 8 o'clock this morning.</p>
<p>A Cape Coral resident along Everest Pkwy we spoke with woke up to her water pressure gone.  She wasn't the only Everest Pkwy resident with a confusing morning. </p>
<p>No one know what caused the water line break on busy Del Prado Blvd., but city crews tell us they suspect it to be from the recent rainfall. </p>
<p>Utilities supervisor, Kevin McGee, said that most of the breaks occur when the rainy season begins. </p>
<p>The water main brake forced the shut down of two southbound lanes on Del Prado Blvd. </p>
<p>Officials confirm that the water is back on for residents, but they are now under a boil water advisory. That means any water used for drinking, cooking, or washing should be boiled first at a rolling boil for one minute.</p>
<p>The other option is to use bottled water until tests confirm the tap water is safe. </p>
<p>Other than a slight impact on Bob Evans, businesses reportedly were not affected. </p>
<p>line.<br/><br/>Drivers are urged to avoid the area if possible.</p></div><!--END WNStoryBody-->

<p>The village of Half Way has lifted the boil order on its water system.</p>
<p>"Repairs have been made and the water sampled and we have been cleared to resume normal operations," clerk Sharon Payne said.</p>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

WEST PALM BEACH, FL (WFLX) - A boil water notice will remain in effect for a small portion of West Palm Beach for the next 48 hours.

This after an overnight watermain break at the corner of Dixie Highway and Belvedere Road.      The break was repaired just a few hours ago.

The boil water notice applies to homes and businesses in the 300 and 700 blocks of Belvedere Road.

<div class="asset-content p402_premium subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<style>#ndn-video-player-1.ndn_embedded .ndn_floatContainer { margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 20px; }</style>
<div class="ndn-container">
<div class="ndn_embed" data-config-distributor-id="91130" data-config-height="9/16w" data-config-width="100%" id="ndn-video-player-1"></div>
</div>
<style>#ndn-video-player-2.ndn_embedded .ndn_floatContainer { margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 20px; }</style>
<div class="ndn-container">
<div class="ndn_embed" data-config-distributor-id="91130" data-config-height="9/16w" data-config-width="100%" id="ndn-video-player-2"></div>
</div>
<p><strong>ELSBERRY</strong> • Residents of the city of Elsberry in Lincoln County are under a boil order until noon Wedneday, after their water service was disrupted this morning while workers place new water lines for a new water tower.</p>
<div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/stltoday.com/news/local/metro" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-top, atf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-top-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center "><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/stltoday.com/news/local/metro" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-inline-video, stf" data-dfp-size="[4,1]" data-lazy="true" id="fixed-inline-video" style="min-height:1px; min-width:4px;"></div></div>
<p>Work on the project began earlier this spring, and residents may expect more disruptions in water service as the work continues, said city clerk Jo Ann Cordsiemon.</p>
<div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/stltoday.com/news/local/metro" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-middle, stf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-middle-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/stltoday.com/news/local/metro" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-bottom, btf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" data-lazy="true" id="fixed-big-ad-bottom-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>
